Name: 7+3, also known as DA or DAC in case of daunorubicin, or IA or IAC in case of idarubicin use
Components: 7 days of Ara-C (cytarabine) plus 3 days of an anthracycline antibiotic, either daunorubicin (DA or DAC variant) or idarubicin (IA or IAC variant)
Example of uses, and other notes: Acute myelogenous leukemia, excluding acute promyelocytic leukemia

Name: BEACOPP
Components: bleomycin, etoposide, doxorubicin (Adriamycin), cyclophosphamide, vincristine (Oncovin), procarbazine, prednisone

Name: ChlVPP/EVA
Components: chlorambucil, vincristine (Oncovin), procarbazine, prednisone, etoposide, vinblastine, doxorubicin (Adriamycin)

Name: COP or CVP
Example of uses, and other notes: non-Hodgkin lymphoma in patients with history of cardiovascular disease

Name: CVAD and Hyper-CVAD
Example of uses, and other notes: aggressive non-Hodgkin lymphoma, lymphoblastic lymphoma, some forms of leukemia

Name: DA or DAC
Components: daunorubicin x 3 days plus ara-C (cytarabine) x 7 days, a variant of 7+3 regimen
Example of uses, and other notes: Acute myeloid leukemia, excluding acute promyelocytic leukemia

Name: DHAP
Components: dexamethasone (a steroid hormone), cytarabine (ara-C), platinum agent

Name: DHAP-R or R-DHAP
Components: dexamethasone (a steroid hormone), cytarabine (ara-C), platinum agent plus rituximab

Name: DT-PACE
Components: dexamethasone, thalidomide, platinum agent, doxorubicin (Adriamycin), cyclophosphamide, etoposide

Name: ECF (MAGIC)
Example of uses, and other notes: gastric cancer and cancer of the esophagogastric junction (Siewert classification III)

Name: EPOCH
Components: etoposide, prednisone, vincristine (Oncovin), cyclophosphamide, and hydroxydaunorubicin

Name: EPOCH-R or R-EPOCH
Components: etoposide, prednisone, vincristine (Oncovin), cyclophosphamide, and hydroxydaunorubicin plus rituximab

Name: ESHAP
Components: etoposide, methylprednisolone (a steroid hormone), cytarabine (ara-C), platinum agent

Name: ESHAP-R or R-ESHAP
Components: etoposide, methylprednisolone (a steroid hormone), cytarabine (ara-C), platinum agent plus rituximab

Name: FCM-R or R-FCM or R-FMC or FMC-R
FM-R or R-FM or RFM or FMR
FEC-T
Components: fluorouracil (5-FU), epirubicin, cyclophosphamide together, followed by docetaxel (Taxotere)

Name: FLAG
Example of uses, and other notes: relapsed or refractory acute myelogenous leukemia

Name: FLAG-Ida or FLAG-IDA or IDA-FLAG or Ida-FLAG
Example of uses, and other notes: relapsed or refractory acute myelogenous leukemia

Name: FLAG-Mito or FLAG-MITO or Mito-FLAG or MITO-FLAG or FLANG[citation needed]
Example of uses, and other notes: relapsed or refractory acute myelogenous leukemia

Name: GC
Components: gemcitabine, cisplatin gemcitabine, dexamethasone, and cisplatin

Name: GemOx-R or GEMOX-R or R-GemOx or R-GEMOX
IA or IAC
Components: idarubicin x 3 days plus Ara-C (cytarabine) x 7 days, a variant of classical 7+3 regimen
Example of uses, and other notes: Acute myelogenous leukemia, excluding acute promyelocytic leukemia

Name: m-BACOD
Components: methotrexate, bleomycin, doxorubicin (Adriamycin), cyclophosphamide, vincristine (Oncovin), dexamethasone

Name: MACOP-B
Components: methotrexate, leucovorin (folinic acid), doxorubicin (Adriamycin), cyclophosphamide, vincristine (Oncovin), prednisone, bleomycin

Name: MINE
Example of uses, and other notes: Non-Hodgkin lymphomas and Hodgkin lymphoma in relapse or refractory cases

Name: MINE-R or R-MINE
Components: mesna, ifosfamide, novantrone, etoposide plus rituximab
Example of uses, and other notes: Non-Hodgkin lymphomas and Hodgkin lymphoma in relapse or refractory cases

Name: ProMACE-CytaBOM
Components: prednisone, doxorubicin (Adriamycin), cyclophosphamide, etoposide, cytarabine, bleomycin, vincristine (Oncovin), methotrexate, leucovorin

Name: R-DHAP or DHAP-R
Components: rituximab + DHAP; that is, rituximab, dexamethasone (a steroid hormone), cytarabine (ara-C), platinum agent
Example of uses, and other notes: relapsed non-Hodgkin's lymphoma and Hodgkin's lymphoma

Name: R-FCM or FCM-R
Components: rituximab + FCM; that is, rituximab, fludarabine, cyclophosphamide, mitoxantrone

Name: R-ICE or ICE-R or RICE
Components: rituximab + ICE; that is, rituximab, ifosfamide, carboplatin, etoposide

Name: Stanford V
Components: doxorubicin (Adriamycin), mechlorethamine, bleomycin, vinblastine, vincristine, etoposide, prednisone

Name: TAC or ACT
Example of uses, and other notes: breast cancer ("TAC" can also refer to tetracaine-adrenaline-cocaine, used as local anesthetic)

Name: TCH
Example of uses, and other notes: breast cancer with positive HER2/neu receptor

Name: TCHP
Example of uses, and other notes: breast cancer with positive HER2/neu receptor

Name: TIP
Example of uses, and other notes: testicular cancer, germ cell tumors in salvage therapy

Name: VAMP
Components: one of 3 combinations of vincristine and others

Name: VAPEC-B
Components: vincristine, doxorubicin (Adriamycin), prednisone, etoposide, cyclophosphamide, bleomycin

Name: VD-PACE
Components: bortezomib, dexamethasone plus platinum agent, doxorubicin (Adriamycin), cyclophosphamide, etoposide

Name: VIP
Components: vinblastine, ifosfamide, platinum agent, (etoposide (VP-16) may substitute for vinblastine, making a regimen sometimes referred to as VIP-16)[9][10]

Name: VTD-PACE
Components: bortezomib (Velcade), thalidomide, dexamethasone plus platinum agent, doxorubicin (Adriamycin), cyclophosphamide, etoposide

Name: V-DCEP
Components: bortezomib (Velcade), dexamethasone, cyclophosphamide, etoposide, platinum agent
